text: today at the western entrance of the
city and a crowded bus stop not far from
the central bus station a bomb went off
as two buses pulled up the bomb seems to
been into one of those rolling suitcases
it killed a 60 year old woman and hurt
several other people and probably a two
dozen other injuries it's been actually
rising tension in recent days in Israel
particularly with the Gaza Strip last
Saturday
Hamas shot about 40 mortars into Israel
it seemed to signal the end of a
ceasefire that's been on for two years
Israel has been retaliated carrying out
attacks in Gaza both from the air and
through artillery yesterday three kids
and a 60 year old man were killed when
attempts to get rocket shooters have
failed and that hit these kids playing
soccer and this man exiting his house
all of this is coming of course in a
much larger context which is that the
entire region has been roiling for about
three months the impact on the
israeli-palestinian conflict has been a
little unclear until now but it does
seem that tensions are rising in this
conflict as well as across the region so
that Israel is worried about its peace
treaty with Egypt this relations with
Turkey and what will happen with Syria
where there's also been unrest in recent
days the Palestinian Authority condemned
the bombing in Jerusalem today but for
Hamas this is the moment to say that
they're the center of resistance against
Israel and to take part in the larger
People's Revolution if you like that's
going on across the region
